awd_titl_txt: Upgrading Geophysics Computer Facilities at USC
awd_abstract_narration: This award provides 51% of the funding required for the                    acquisition of computing hardware and software to upgrade the                   geophysical computing facility in the Department of Geological                  Sciences at the University of Southern California. The University               is committed to providing the remaining 49% of the funding.                          The improved computing facility will be used for                           computationally-intensive research projects that include:                       investigation of earthquake source properties, near-field effects               and site responses for large earthquakes; spatial and temporal                  variations of coda-Q in relation to earthquake processes;                       depiction of the crustal structure and evolution of the                         southwestern U.S. using multichannel seismic reflection profiles;               study of friction and fracture instabilities in fault zones; and                a damage mechanics approach to the source mechanism of                          underground nuclear explosions.
